title: Schisandra total lignans ameliorate neuronal ferroptosis in 3xTg-AD mice via regulating NADK/NADPH/GSH pathway.
abstract: Alzheimer's disease (AD) is a progressive neurodegenerative disorder with limited treatments. Schisandra total lignans (STL), the primary active component of Schisandra chinensis, shows potential in alleviating AD-related symptoms, though the mechanisms remain unclear.
journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology
